neighbors.name: Rancho Del Sol Brillante Owners
neighbors.claims: The identified parcels (411-38-001K, 411-38-002A) correspond to the "Rancho Del Sol Brillante" project, a proposed 1,600-acre master-planned community and agricultural site in Eloy, AZ, rather than the "Casa Grande West" subdivision ([Nathan & Associates](https://nathanlandaz.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/1612-Rancho-Del-Sol-Brilliante-Email-1.pdf)). The property has been listed as "Currently Farmed" with future zoning designated for a master-planned community ([Nathan & Associates](https://nathanlandaz.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/1612-Rancho-Del-Sol-Brilliante-Email-1.pdf)). Previous development agreements regarding this project were terminated by the City of Eloy due to lack of progress ([Rose Law Group](https://roselawgroupreporter.com/2020/01/eloy-ends-agreement-with-development-that-never-progressed/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Absentee investment group; project history indicates stalled development.

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact the brokerage representing the land (Nathan & Associates) or the registered owners to discuss land use compatibility, as the site has been marketed for master-planned development.

citations.claim: The identified parcels (411-38-001K, 411-38-002A) correspond to the "Rancho Del Sol Brillante" project, a proposed 1,600-acre master-planned community and agricultural site in Eloy, AZ, rather than the "Casa Grande West" subdivision

neighbors.verification_notes: CORRECTION: The PINs provided (411-38-xxx) belong to the 'Rancho Del Sol Brillante' project in Eloy, NOT the 'Casa Grande West' subdivision (which has 503-xx PINs). The profile name and claims were updated to match the PINs, which are the primary identifier.

neighbors.name: Timothy A. & Evelyn P. Robinson
neighbors.claims: Timothy A. Robinson and Evelyn P. Robinson are associated with property ownership in Pinal County ([Elementix](https://elementix.ai/investors/az/timothy-robinson)). Timothy A. Robinson serves as the President of Arizona Machinery & Supply, Inc. and has previously served on the board of directors for Capitol Bancorp Limited ([SEC](https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/840264/000084026409000030/exhibit13.htm)). He was recently appointed as a Personal Representative for a local estate in Pinal County Superior Court ([Copper Area News](https://copperarea.com/wp-content/uploads/11_13_24-Superior-Sun.pdf)). The property in the area is zoned "General Rural" (GR), which allows for low-density residential and agricultural uses ([Zoneomics](https://www.zoneomics.com/code/pinal-county-unincorporated-AZ)).
neighbors.influence_justification: President of local machinery company; former bank board member; court-appointed representative.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Timothy Robinson as a business professional and community stakeholder. Given his leadership role at Arizona Machinery & Supply, approach with a focus on technical competence and economic impacts.
